MARTIAL ARTIST • GAMER • HIP-HOP CONNOISSEUR • DOG DAD

Forever passionate about crafting intuitive and engaging experiences for users. My journey started with a fascination for taking things apart and putting them back together differently, a curiosity that drives many of my design decisions.

As a US Navy veteran who established my formal training through a Graphic Design/Interactive Media degree from Columbia College, I possess a diverse experience in leadership, education, and always wanting to learn the why and not just the how. My initial foray into the creativity of graphic design and the functionality of web design led me to discover the perfect blend of both worlds in UX design. This field allows me to combine my skills in visual aesthetics with a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors.

My toolkit encompasses UX research, UI design, and a solid foundation in web development. I've successfully tackled various independent projects that pique my various interests, such as designing a quarterly newsletter for a Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) post, improving old-school arcade functionality with today’s mobile technology, and creating projects out of everyday design flaws like my city’s penchant for confusing road signs. My work consistently aims to push creative boundaries and deliver impactful results, and always for the end user.

Let's design.
